title: Intel results to spotlight turnaround efforts as AI data centers boost chip demand
summary: Intel shareholders are optimistic about the company's results like they have not been for many quarters, betting the turnaround CEO Lip-Bu Tan promised was taking root and that rapid data center build outs were fueling strong demand ​for its traditional server chips.  A slew of high-profile investments engineered by Tan last year piqued investor interest in a stock that ‌had crashed in 2024 following years of management missteps, including a botched AI product roadmap that led to deep competitive losses and thousands of job cuts.  Intel's stock gained 84% in 2025, ‌far outperforming the benchmark semiconductor index's 42% rise.

raw.headline: Intel results to spotlight turnaround efforts as AI data centers boost chip demand

Intel's stock gained 84% in 2025, ‌far outperforming the benchmark semiconductor index's 42% rise.

title: Treasury Yield Spike Can’t Be Ignored. Stocks Are Vulnerable to ‘Sell America’ Pressures.
summary: The current turmoil in global bond markets, which has triggered a spike in U.S. Treasury yields and a record slump in Japan, could have big implications for stock markets heading into a crucial early stretch of the new year.  President Donald Trump’s vow to take over Greenland “one way or the other,” as well as his new tariff threats on European allies and the ongoing pressure on Federal Reserve independence, has stoked a new phase of the so-called Sell America trade in bond markets that spilled over violently into stocks on the first day of the holiday-shortened week.  The bond market slump Tuesday, which was accelerated by a looming fiscal crisis in Japan as the country heads toward a snap national election next month, lifted benchmark  10-year Treasury note  yields just past 4.3%, the highest since August 2025.

raw.headline: Treasury Yield Spike Can’t Be Ignored. Stocks Are Vulnerable to ‘Sell America’ Pressures.
raw.summary: The current turmoil in global bond markets, which has triggered a spike in U.S. Treasury yields and a record slump in Japan, could have big implications for stock markets heading into a crucial early stretch of the new year.  President Donald Trump’s vow to take over Greenland “one way or the other,” as well as his new tariff threats on European allies and the ongoing pressure on Federal Reserve independence, has stoked a new phase of the so-called Sell America trade in bond markets that spilled over violently into stocks on the first day of the holiday-shortened week.  The bond market slump Tuesday, which was accelerated by a looming fiscal crisis in Japan as the country heads toward a snap national election next month, lifted benchmark  10-year Treasury note  yields just past 4.3%, the highest since August 2025.

title: Amazon Investors Bet on AWS to Pull the Stock Out of Its Malaise
summary: The optimism starts with demand for the Amazon Web Services cloud-computing business, which is positioned to benefit from the explosion of artificial intelligence technology.  “An improvement in AWS should help materially in terms of the perception of the stock as being the relative loser in cloud,” said Pat Burton, a portfolio manager at Winslow Capital Management, who counts Amazon as one of his biggest overweights among the Magnificent Seven tech giants.  Amazon shares were the worst performers among the Mag Seven in 2025, their seventh straight year trailing the group.

title: US futures edge higher and gold hits another record as markets swoon over Greenland dispute
summary: Asian shares mostly extended their losses on Wednesday and gold prices hit a record high as concerns over U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariff threats on Greenland fueled unease among investors.  U.S. futures rose after steep losses Tuesday on Wall Street.  Gold prices crossed the $4,800 mark for the first time, gaining 1.7% as money flowed into assets considered to be safe havens at times of uncertainty.

And as if the worries about the AI bubble weren’t enough, other big tech stocks, including Apple, Meta, Microsoft, Tesla, and Google, are also down, as ...

title: The Ithaka Group Q4 2025 Performance, Contributors And Detractors
summary: Ithaka Group's portfolio underperformed the Russell 1000 Growth Index by 700bps in Q4 2025. Read the full analysis of top contributors and detractors here.

title: Dow Jones Tumbles As Trump's Greenland Threats Spur Sell The U.S. Trade; Tesla, Nvidia Skid
summary: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq broke key support on Trump's Greenland push with his Davos speech on tap. Nvidia, Tesla and other megacaps slumped. Netflix fell late.
